text:

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Hundreds of cars parade out of Golden Gate Park late Thursday afternoon to show solidarity with the recent protests.  The caravan IS scheduled to do a 10-mile loop through San Francisco. https://t.co/aSpx3VWItd

name: sfchronicle
text:

Here's a list of the closest open stores to you (store hours vary by location so call ahead): https://t.co/sSqZIFfxJ8

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Hundreds of demonstrators fill Fernandez Park in Pinole as part of a ‚ÄúGeorge Floyd Solidarity‚Äù protest. The demonstration, which was led by black and community organizers of color, is scheduled to include a march to the Pinole Police Department.  https://t.co/6BA1GH5Ni4

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Gavin Newsom says he‚Äôs concerned about the spread of coronavirus as protests against police brutality continue across the state. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not (concerned), you‚Äôre not paying attention ... to the virulence of this disease,‚Äù he said in Stockton. https://t.co/lqK7YRAI3i https://t.co/ee0G1rVT8z

name: sfchronicle
text:
Lunchtime yoga ‚Äî six feet apart, of course ‚Äî in front of the @calacademy colony of African penguins takes care of two birds with one pose. 

Staff gets a healthful, anxiety-reducing break, and the penguins get their ‚Äúpeople TV‚Äù back.

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Several hundred people who congregated at Oakland City Hall begin marching up Telegraph Avenue before turning onto W. Grand Avenue. They chanted ‚ÄúNo justice, no peace‚Äù and held cardboard signs overhead while nearby cars honked in support. https://t.co/y1sozd7mCh

text:

text: The new rules ‚Äúwill reverse decades of effort to end the corrosive effects of sexual harassment on equal access to education,‚Äù lawyers for 17 states and the District of Columbia said in a federal court filing.  https://t.co/aNpd9B0WUS

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The city of Concord‚Äôs curfew, which police said was formed in ‚Äúresponse to the unpredictable nature of the civil unrest in the region,‚Äù will remain in effect until Monday, June 8.  https://t.co/Yl9e8N6ZEE

name: sfchronicle
text:
Join Chronicle writer @JanelleBitker and Aomboon Deasy of K&J Orchards for a live video chat Tuesday, June 9 at 6:00 p.m. Hear about how the farm is adapting during the pandemic, get a peek at the orchards, and learn how you can help local farms.

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Four Berkeley city council members called on Berkeley police to stop using tear gas, pepper spray, smoke bombs, and other chemical agents as crowd control measures, citing a concern that it could cause a spike in coronavirus cases.

https://t.co/zoH21NFSgb

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: In a Twitter thread detailing a peaceful protest and march, @MountainViewPD shared a photo of four of its officers kneeling along with protesters. In the Tweet, police wrote, ‚ÄúWe see you. We hear you. We are here with you.‚Äù

Live updates: https://t.co/Uc0KJ0EkeB https://t.co/rXX7iaNJ9y

name: sfchronicle
text: PROTEST UPDATES: Video shows Buffalo police officers shoving man, who falls and hits his head. The clip appears to show an older protester who encounters a phalanx of police officers, get shoved, stumbles backward and then starts bleeding from the head. https://t.co/kizWbNfjy6

name: sfchronicle
text: From columnist @otisrtaylorjr: To understand why the protests are necessary, look no further than Vallejo. https://t.co/0PCBne6ie2

name: sfchronicle
text: Saints QB Drew Brees issued an apology on Thursday for his gale of words that cut a path through the NFL, the sports landscape and the New Orleans community a day earlier. It seems inexcusable that Brees could trot out such tired words, writes @AnnKillion. https://t.co/pLHJ7xcAQW
